questions.question: Exploring to see what you can find.
Frantically escaping from a terrifying foe.
Working out how to crack a challenging puzzle.
The struggle to difficult boss.
Playing in a group, online or in the same room.
Responding quickly to an exciting situation.
Picking up every single collectible in an area.
Looking around just to enjoy the scenery.
Being in control at high speed.
Devising a promising strategy when deciding what to try next.
Feeling relief when you escape to a safe area.
Taking on a strong opponent when playing against a human player in a versus match.
Talking with other players, online or in the same room.
Finding what you need to complete a collection.
Hanging from a high ledge.
Wondering what's behind a locked door.
Feeling scared, terrified or disturbed.
Working out what to do on your own.
Completing a punishing challenge after failing many times.
Co-operating with strangers.
Getting 100% (completing everything in a game).
Arrange the following experiences into a sequence from best to worst.

options.answer: A moment of jaw-dropping wonder or beauty.
An experience of primeval terror that blows your mind.
A moment of breathtaking speed or vertigo.
The moment when the solution to a difficult puzzle clicks in your mind.
A moment when you feel an intense sense of unity with another player.
A moment of completeness that you have strived for.

questions.question: When I buy clothes, I always pay attention to the brand. After all, I want to belong.
Shopping is not a necessary evil, it's almost a hobby. I buy something even if I don't actually need it.
When I go shopping, I usually spend more money than I actually wanted to.
When I go shopping, I don't care about the price. I buy what I feel like buying.
Do I wash or dry clean myself? - When shopping, I rarely or never pay attention to the care instructions on the garment.
I don't care about test, quality and environmental labels when making my purchasing decisions.
Comparing prices is for bores. I buy straight away. Not that someone else will snatch it away from me.
If I see an item of clothing or accessory that I like on my favorite movie, TV or music star, then I have to have it.
I'm not interested in the conditions under which clothes are made. The main thing is that they are cheap - no matter how much money I have at my disposal.
I'm very interested in what other people think is cool. Fashion and lifestyle magazines are therefore my favorite reading.
Being with other people generally gives me a lot of energy.
I feel most comfortable when I am alone.
I like meeting lots of people and having fun with them.
When I'm with a lot of people, I prefer to stay in the background.
Talking to other people motivates me and brings out the best in me.
I usually prefer to do things on my own.
I always enjoy meeting new people.
Being with other people is often exhausting for me.
I feel best when I have lots of people around me.
I don't get enthusiastic about other people easily.
When I'm working on something, I'm easily distracted.
If I have a plan, I do everything I can to realize it.
When I encounter difficulties in executing a plan, I tend to give up quickly.
I had no problem working hard for something, that will only bear fruit after a relatively long time.
I often don't follow through with my plans.
When I'm following a plan, I'm not easily distracted by short-term needs.
I often set myself a goal without really trying to achieve it.
When I set myself a goal, I pursue it very doggedly.
It is very difficult for me to follow a plan if it requires me to ignore momentary needs.
When I set my mind to something, I stick to it, no matter how long it takes.
I'm rarely afraid that other people won't like me.
When I meet up with friends, I sometimes have the feeling that they talk badly about me afterwards.
I never doubt that I deserve to be accepted by others.
I often doubt the permanence of my relationships.
Even if friends or relatives don't contact me for a long time, I don't assume that it's because of me.
If a person doesn't get in touch with me for a long time, I quickly start to question my relationship with them.
If someone important to me is behaving strangely, I rarely suspect that it might have something to do with me.
If other people let it be known that they don't like something about me, my mood can quickly turn negative.
If friends or acquaintances don't pay enough attention to me, I rarely have the feeling that they don't like me anymore.
If I receive signals of rejection from other people, I am immediately worried and think about the possible reason.
I enjoy thinking about new solutions to problems.
For me, thinking is not associated with fun.
I like to think about what society could look like in the future.
I don't like to think about things when there is no clear need for it.
I love thinking about complex topics like the meaning of life or world politics.
I don't like to play mind games.
I really like to keep myself mentally occupied.
I prefer to deal with everyday things rather than think about theoretical topics.
I feel best when I am challenged mentally.
I don't like thinking about unconventional ideas.
I would rather share than compete with others to get something all for myself.
My own well-being is more important to me than other people's problems.
I prefer not to assert my interests if they conflict with other people's feelings.
I don't like to help other people if it puts me at a disadvantage.
I like to be generous without expecting anything in return.
In conflicts of interest with others, I always try to get the maximum for myself.
When I share something with others, I don't mind if others get more than I do.
I don't like to do a person a favor if I know that I won't get anything back from them later.
I would help other people even if I had a lot of problems myself.
I had no problems asserting my interests at the expense of others.
